description: Redevelopment of the site involving the erection of a building subdivided into 6 (six) units totalling 4,864 m2 for B1(c) - light industrial, B2 - general industrial and B8 (storage and distribution) use with associated loading / unloading arrangements, commercial vehicular turning, car parking and landscaping.
decision_conditions: Time Limits  The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Approved Plans  The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers and associated documents:  Site Plan and full plans for development under ref Site Location Plan PL001 and plans under ref: PL002, PL003, PL004, PL005, PL006  unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Materials to Match  The development shall be consturcted using the external finishes specified on drawing PL004  unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate for the development and to  safeguard the character and appearance of the surrounding area, in accordance with policies 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011. | Hard and Soft Landscaping  Notwithstanding any indications as to these matters that have been given in the planning application, details of both hard and soft landscape works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority and permanently retained thereafter.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the site is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 4.5 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011. | Continued Landscaping Maintenance  Details of the arrangements to ensure the continued maintenance of all hard and soft landscaped areas shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall in place prior to occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is properly maintained to provide a satisfactory setting for the development, in accordance with policies 3.2, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Construction Logistics Plan  6.	Notwithstanding the approved details, no development shall take place until details of a Demolition and Construction Logistics Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:   +	Proposed on-site construction worker parking  +	Dust suppression measures +	Wheel washing provisions  +	Site security during construction +	On site storage  +	Tree protection  +	Construction vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear +	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents +	Details of any temporary vehicular access   The Demolition and Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.    Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.11 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2011, supllementary Planning guidance 10 'Noise and vibration' and Supplementary Planning guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' | Green Travel Plan  A travel plan designed to  manage the transport needs of staff and visitors to the development (including targets and  monitoring) to minimise  car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be  submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, which shall be in  accordance with Tfl's updated planning guidance. The travel plan shall be implemented as approved, and shall be retained in operation thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. Thereafter, an annual monitoring report shall be submitted to the local planning authority, unless otherwise requested.    Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 21, and policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.10, 6.11, 6.12, 6.13 of The London Plan (2011). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority, prior to installation to demonstrate that static and mobile plant audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together not exceeding:  -	LFNR35 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves) for plant which will operate during the period of 2300 - 0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. -	LFNR40 Leq,1hr (one-third octaves) for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays.  Reason: To safeguard the working conditions of adjoining occupiers, including occupiers of the proposed offices, against noise disturbance, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10: Noise and Vibration. | Mitigation of Light Pollution  Details of all proposed lighting schemes for the development shall be submitted for approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced.  The information submitted shall include: 1.	A layout plan with beam orientation. 2.	A schedule of equipment in the design (luminaire type; mounting height; aiming angles and luminaire profiles). 3.	An isolux contour map to show light spill levels down to 1 lux and showing neighbouring buildings, and: the recommendations made at the following guidance shall be met where appropriate: ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011 CIBSE/SLL - FF7 Environmental Considerations for Exterior Lighting CIBSE/SLL - LG6 Lighting Guide - Outdoor Lighting CIE 92 - Guide for Floodlighting BS 5489 Part 3 Code of Practice for Lighting for Subsidiary Roads and Associated Pedestrian Areas Reason: To provide adequate lighting to the proposed development and protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policy 4.12 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | BREEAM - Pre-Occupation (New build non-residential)  Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, no part of the development hereby approved shall be used or occupied until a Post-Construction Review Certificate issued by the Building Research Establishment confirming that the non-residential development has achieved a BREEAM rating of not less than 'Very Good' has been submitted to and acknowledged in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development achieves a high level of sustainability and makes efficient use of resources is sustainable, in accordance with Policy 5.3 of the Adopted London Plan (July 2011). | Notwithstanding the approved details, measures to achieve a 25% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions including from the use of on-site renewable energy sources, including measures to monitor renewable energy production shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority (the baseline for such calculations being in accordance with Policy 5.2 of the London Plan 2011). The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved measures, which shall be permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure that the development supports the Mayor's Climate Change Mitigation and Energy Strategy and to meet the objectives of policy 5.2 of the Adopted London Plan 2011. | Refuse and Recycling  Refuse and recycling storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be provided. Such provision shall be installed and implemented prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living and working conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the environment and the street scene, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities and policy 5.16 of The London Plan (2011) | Access and servicing  Areas shown on the approved plan as access and servicing areas shall be completed and marked out on-site prior to first occupation of any part of the development.   REASON: To ensure that suitable access and servicing space is available within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 6.3, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of The London Plan (2011). | Car Parking  The general and disabled car parking spaces shown on approved plan  PL 002 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 6.3, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of The London Plan (2011). | Redundant Accesses  All existing accesses to the site which would be made redundant by the development hereby approved shall be permanently closed before any part of the development is occupied or brought into use; and the footway shall be reinstated.  REASON: In the interests of highway safety and the visual amenity of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 6.3, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of The London Plan (2011). | Means of Access  The vehicular means of access as shown on approved plan PL 002 shall be constructed prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and be kept clear of any obstructions to visibility above a height of 0.6m.  REASON: In the interests of vehicular and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 6.3, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of The London Plan (2011). | Cycle Parking  Cycle parking for 24 cycles as detailed within the application shall be in place prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Use Restriction  Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, the premises shall only be used for B1c/B2/B8 use and the associated ancillary uses as described in the application, and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.   Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the employment status of the Park Royal Industrial Park Major Employment Location, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.11 and 6.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004) and policy 4.4 of The London Plan (July 2011). | No Paint Spraying  No paint spraying or operations giving rise to odour shall be conducted without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:   To protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policy 2.6 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 3 'Air Quality and Pollution'. | Petrol/Oil Interdceptors  Petrol/oil interceptors shall be fitted to all car parking/washing/repair facilities within the development hereby approved.  REASON: To prevent pollution of the water environment, in accordance with policy 2.5 of Ealing's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 5.14 of the adopted London Plan (2011)
